alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 6:24AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Major changes to the weather expected this weekend... The high pressure system that has brought the pleasant weather to northern and central Nevada will continue to break down over the next several days. In its place low pressure, now in the Gulf of Alaska, will dive to the southeast and towards the forecast area during the late Friday to early Saturday timeframe. Breezy to windy conditions will develop out ahead of the system with west to southwest winds of 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 to 40 mph expected Friday afternoon. By early Saturday morning, the low pressure system is anticipated to be over the Pacific Northwest, with rain showers developing in northern Nevada. A strong cold front will push through the area late Saturday afternoon and into Sunday morning. Strong winds out ahead of the front with speeds of 15 to 30 mph with gusts of 45 mph are possible. In addition, rain will changeover to light snow after the frontal passage with some light accumulations of an inch or two expected at the higher passes and summits in the forecast area, especially along the US Highway 50 corridor in central Nevada. Much cooler weather is expected Sunday and Monday with highs in the 40s and 50s. Stayed tuned to the forecast for updates as this weather system brings to the area the first snow of the season. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
